meanings.definition: One who gives a surname to someone.
meanings.sent1: The surnamer helped the family choose a last name.
meanings.sent2: The surnamer filled out the official paperwork for the new surname.
meanings.sent3: The surnamer joked that he should start a business naming people.
meanings.sent4: The surnamer was like a wizard, bestowing new identities with a wave of his pen.
meanings.sent5: The surnamer's job was to make sure everyone had a proper family name.

meanings.definition: A person who is named after someone else.
meanings.sent1: The young boy was a surnamer, named after his grandfather.
meanings.sent2: She was a surnamer, carrying on the legacy of her great-grandmother.
meanings.sent3: The surnamer proudly shared stories of the relative he was named after.
meanings.sent4: Being a surnamer felt like walking in the footsteps of a legend.
meanings.sent5: The surnamer felt a deep connection to the person whose name he bore.
